anvil.api.Internal

Class RunnerManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • anvil.api.Internal.RunnerManager

  • public abstract class RunnerManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a manager/database for Runner objects.

    Runner objects are the objects that contain and run the Minecraft servers. The RunnerManager is a way for Anvil to recognize and use each Runner object. If a Runner object is created by a PlugIn object and not added to the RunnerManager, it will not be recognized by the rest of the wrapper.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Garrett Stonis
    See Also:
    Runner, PlugIn

    • Constructor Detail

      • RunnerManager

        public RunnerManager()

    • Method Detail

      • addRunner

        public static void addRunner(Runner runner)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Adds a Runner object to the manager. This operation is necessary for Anvil to recognize Runner objects. Anvil adds its own Runners (specified by the user in the GUI/CLI) before PlugIns add theirs.

        Once added, a Runner object cannot be removed from the manager. Shutting down the wrapper is the only way to clear the manager.

        All new Runner objects should be created and added inside of the PlugIn.onLoad() method.

        Parameters:
        runner - Runner object to add to the manager.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When the given runner's tag is already found in the manager.

      • getRunner

        public static Runner getRunner(java.lang.String tag)
        Gets the Runner object from the manager with the given tag.

        All of the Runner objects retrieved this way are mutable, so take care not to mess up the Runners when altering them, it can throw a wrench in many PlugIns and Anvil itself.

        Parameters:
        tag - String object containing the tag of the desired Runner.
        Returns:
        Runner object in the manager containing the given tag. Null if no such object exists.

      • getMainConfigFile

        public static ConfigFile getMainConfigFile()
        Gets the main config file of the wrapper.

        This contains useful information for Anvil to work properly, but also acts as a centralized config file if there exists a desire to add to it.

        Returns:
        ConfigFile object containing the main config file.

      • setMainConfigFile

        public static void setMainConfigFile(ConfigFile config)
        Sets the main config file of the wrapper.

        This only does anything after being run for the first time, which Anvil does.

        Parameters:
        config - ConfigFile object to set the main config file to.
